change.item:
$Log: ml.xml,v $ Revision 1.4 2004/12/14 19:42:20 packel added entry/sense ids; fixed bad empty tags
Revision 1.3 2004/12/03 20:11:37 packel corrected some duplicate keys caused by fixing the compound verbs
Revision 1.2 2004/12/02 23:29:11 packel added key attributes to compound verb entries
Revision 1.1 2004/11/22 17:07:40 packel converted to P4/XML
Revision 1.20 2004/10/18 18:17:47 packel added div0s; changed orth ʼa)da/mas,ʼ to a)da/mas
Revision 1.19 2004/10/07 14:18:11 packel removed *s in entry keys
Revision 1.18 2004/10/05 21:34:13 packel Aligned dictionary entries with the LSJ.
Revision 1.17 2004/09/08 15:49:42 packel Changed doctype to TEI P4
Revision 1.16 2004/09/01 15:44:25 packel Fixed thirty-odd words that had multiple entries but no number afterward to differentiate the entries (e.g., si=gma, si=gma is now si=gma1, si=gma2).
Revision 1.15 2004/06/15 19:31:34 lcerrato changed nothwithstanding to notwithstanding
Revision 1.14 2003/02/04 21:21:51 lcerrato fixed typo kuma entry swoln to swollen
Revision 1.13 2001/12/05 15:15:58 gcrane shifted the lemma for "pa/nth" to be "pa/nth|"
Revision 1.12 2001/04/20 21:58:57 dasmith Added funder.
Revision 1.11 2001/04/05 18:26:02 lcerrato added trans tags to noeo^ entry where missing
Revision 1.10 2000/10/06 23:20:04 dasmith Tagged inflectional info as Greek.
Revision 1.9 2000/10/06 21:44:13 dasmith Added author and ISBN to head. Use new DTD subset. Explicitly tag lemmata and cross references as Greek.
Revision 1.8 2000/03/04 20:25:11 dasmith Standardized language IDs. Added key attribute to entry.
Revision 1.7 1998/08/24 19:15:31 jrydberg finished trans tags and added new prep. defs.
Revision 1.6 1998/08/20 17:12:45 jrydberg Included greek words within trans tags where appropriate
Revision 1.5 1998/08/19 20:50:08 jrydberg Replaced all "(trans) or (/trans)" with " or "
Revision 1.4 1998/08/19 18:23:58 jrydberg Corrected trans tagging for short defs. through a)mfote/rwqen.
Revision 1.3 1998/08/17 20:24:43 jrydberg *** empty log message ***
Revision 1.2 1998/08/17 19:38:25 jrydberg Updated entry for *)agamemno/neos
Revision 1.1 1998/08/14 15:38:33 textgod Added to repository.

div0.head: Ρ

div1.head: ῥαββί
div1.sense: o my master, Hebr. words in NTest.

div1.head: ῥαβδίον
div1.sense: a little rod, a wand, Babr.

div1.head: ῥαβδομαχία
div1.sense: a fighting with a staff or foil, Plut.

div1.head: ῥαβδονομέω
div1.sense: to sit as umpire, Soph.

div1.head: ῥαβδονόμος
div1.sense: holding a rod or wand; hence, like ῥαβδοῦχος, of the Rom. lictors, Plut.

div1.head: ῥάβδος
div1.sense: a rod, wand, stick, switch, Lat. virga, Hom., Xen.
a magic wand, as that of Circe or Hermes, Hom.
a fishing-rod, Od.:—also a limed twig, for catching birds, Ar.
a spear-staff or shaft, Xen.
a staff of office, like the earlier σκῆπτρον, Pind.
the wand borne by the ῥαψῳδός· hence, κατὰ ῥάβδον ἐπέων according to the measure of his (Homerʼs) verses, Pind.
a rod for chastisement, Plat.; αἱ ῥάβδοι the fasces of the Roman lictors, Plut.
a stripe or strip, Il.

div1.head: ῥαβδουχέω
div1.sense: to carry a rod or wand, as a badge of office:—Pass., at Rome, to have the fasces borne before one, Plut.

div1.head: ῥαβδουχία
div1.sense: at Rome, the fasces, Plut.

div1.head: ῥαβδοῦχος
div1.sense: one who carries a rod or staff of office:
a judge, umpire at a contest, Plat.
a magistrateʼs attendant, a beadle, Ar.:—so, at Rome, of the lictors who carried the fasces, Polyb., etc.

div1.head: ῥαβδοφορέω
div1.sense: to carry a wand or stick, Strab.

div1.head: ῥάβδωσις
div1.sense: the fluting of columns, Arist.

div1.head: ῥαβδωτός
div1.sense: striped, Xen.

div1.head: ῥαγάς
div1.sense: a rent, chink, Anth.

div1.head: ῥαγδαῖος
div1.sense: tearing, furious, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ῥαγίζω
div1.sense: to gather grapes, Theocr.

div1.head: ῥαγολόγος
div1.sense: gathering berries, Anth.

div1.head: ῥαδινάκη
div1.sense: the Persian name for a black strong smelling petroleum, Hdt.

div1.head: ῥαδινός
div1.sense: slender, taper, Il., Theogn., etc.
of the limbs or body, taper, slim, Hes., Theogn.
generally, tender or mobile, ὄσσε Aesch.

div1.head: ῥᾴδιος
div1.sense: easy, ready, easy to make or do, opp. to χαλεπός, Hom., etc.; ῥηίδιόν τοι ἔπος a word easy for thee to understand, Od.:—c. inf., τάφρος ῥηιδίη περῆσαι easy to pass over, Il.; ῥηίτεροι πολεμίζειν easier to fight with, Il.
ῥᾴδιόν ἐστι it is easy to do a thing, c. inf., Pind., Thuc.; c. acc. et inf., τύραννον εὐσεβεῖν οὐ ῥᾴδιον Soph.; also, ῥᾷστοί εἰσιν ἀμύνεσθαι ῥᾴδιόν ἐστιν αὐτοὺς ἀμύνεσθαι, Thuc.
also, ῥᾴδιόν ἐστι it is a light matter, you think little of doing, παρʼ ὑμῖν ῥ. ξενοκτονεῖν Eur.
of persons, easy, complaisant, Lat. facilis, commodus, Dem.:—in bad sense, reckless, Luc.
adv. ῥᾳδίως, Epic and Ionic ῥηιδίως, easily, lightly, readily, willingly, Hom., etc.; ῥᾳδίως φέρειν to bear lightly, make light of a thing, Eur., etc.
in bad sense, lightly, recklessly, rashly, Thuc.; ῥᾳδίως οὕτω in this easy, thoughtless way, Plat.
comp., ῥᾷον φέρειν Thuc.
Sup. ῥᾷστα, esp. in phrases, ῥᾷστα φέρειν Soph.; ὡς ῥᾷστα φέρειν Aesch.

div1.head: ῥᾳδιουργέω
div1.sense: to do things with ease or off-hand, Luc.
to live an easy, lazy life, take things easily, Xen.
to act thoughtlessly or recklessly, to do wrong, misbehave, Xen.

div1.head: ῥᾳδιούργημα
div1.sense: a reckless act, crime, Plut.

div1.head: ῥᾳδιουργία
div1.sense: ease in doing, facility, Xen.
easiness, laziness, sloth, Xen.
recklessness, want of principle, wickedness, lewdness, Xen.: fraud, Plut.

div1.head: ῥᾳδιουργός
div1.sense: properly, doing things easily; in bad sense, unscrupulous, reckless, Arist.
of things, impure, Xen.

div1.head: ῥαθάμιγξ
div1.sense: a drop, Il., Hes.
of solids, a grain, bit, Il.

div1.head: ῥαθαπυγίζω
div1.sense: to give one a slap on the buttocks, Ar.

div1.head: ῥαθυμέω
div1.sense: to leave off work, to be remiss, Xen.

div1.head: ῥαθυμία
div1.sense: easiness of temper, a taking things easily, Thuc.
recreation, relaxation, amusement, Eur.
in bad sense, indifference, sluggishness, laziness, Xen., etc.; ῥ. κτήσασθαι to get a name for laziness, Eur.
heedlessness, rashness, Plat.

div1.head: ῥάθυμος
div1.sense: taking things easy, indifferent, lazy, sluggish, Lat. socors, Soph., etc.
of things, easy, Lat. securus, Isocr., Plat.:—adv. -μως, Plat.
adv. also, like ῥᾳδίως, lightly, with equanimity, Plat.; comp. -ότερον, Isocr.; -οτέρως, Arist.

div1.head: ῥαιβόκρανος
div1.sense: with crooked head, Anth.

div1.head: ῥαιβοσκελής
div1.sense: crook-legged, Anth.

div1.head: ῥαιβός
div1.sense: crooked, bent, Arist.

div1.head: ῥαΐζω
div1.sense: to grow easier, find relief, recover from illness, Plat., Dem.:— to take oneʼs rest, Xen.

div1.head: ῥαίνω
div1.sense: to sprinkle, besprinkle, ῥάσσατε (sc. δῶμα ὕδατι) Od.; αἵματι βωμόν Eur.:—Pass., πύργοι αἵματι ἐρράδατʼ Il.; αἵματι δʼ ἐρράδαται τοῖχοι Od.:—of dust, ἵπποι ῥαίνοντο κονίηι Il.
metaph., ῥ. τινὰ ὕμνωι Pind.
to sprinkle, with acc. of the thing sprinkled, ῥαίνειν ἐς τὰ βλέφαρα to sprinkle (vinegar) in their eyes, Ar.

div1.head: ῥαιστήρ
div1.sense: a hammer, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: ῥαίω
div1.sense: to break, shiver, shatter, wreck, Od.;— Pass., ῥαιόμενος one shipwrecked, Od.; φάσγανον ἐρραίσθη was shivered, Il.
to crush, destroy, in Pass., Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ῥακά
div1.sense: Hebr. word expressive of utter contempt, NTest.

div1.head: ῥάκιον
div1.sense: a rag, in pl. rags, Ar.

div1.head: ῥακιοσυρραπτάδης
div1.sense: a rag-stitcher, Ar.

div1.head: ῥακόδυτος
div1.sense: ragged, Eur.

div1.head: ῥακόεις
div1.sense: ragged, torn, tattered, Anth.
wrinkled, Anth.

div1.head: ῥάκος
div1.sense: a ragged garment, a rag, Od., Ar.: in pl. ῥάκεα, Attic ῥάκη, rags, tatters, Od., Hdt., etc.
generally, a strip of cloth, Hdt.: a strip of flesh, Aesch.
in pl. rents in the face, wrinkles, Ar.
metaph. a rag, remnant, Anon. ap. Arist.; of an old seaman, ἁλίοιο βίου ῥάκος Anth.

div1.head: ῥακόω
div1.sense: to tear in strips, Plut.

div1.head: ῥάκωμα
div1.sense: in pl., = ῥάκη, rags, Ar.

div1.head: ῥάμφος
div1.sense: a beak, bill, neb, Ar.

div1.head: ῥανίς
div1.sense: a drop, Eur.; a rain-drop, Ar.

div1.head: ῥαντήριος
div1.sense: of or for sprinkling:—in Aesch., it seems to be bedabbled, reeking.

div1.head: ῥαντίζω
div1.sense: = ῥαίνω, NTest.
of the effect, to purify, NTest.

div1.head: ῥαντισμός
div1.sense: a sprinkling, NTest.

div1.head: ῥάξ
div1.sense: a grape, Lat. racemus, Plat.

div1.head: ῥαπίζω
div1.sense: to strike with a stick, to cudgel, flog, bastinado, Hdt., Dem.
to slap in the face, NTest.

div1.head: ῥάπισμα
div1.sense: a stroke, a slap on the face, Luc.

div1.head: ῥαπτός
div1.sense: stitched, patched, Od.
metaph. strung together, continuous, of verses, Pind.
worked with the needle: ῥαπτόν, οῦ, an embroidered carpet, Xen.; ῥαπτὴ σφαῖρα a stitched ball, of divers colours, Anth.

div1.head: ῥάπτω
div1.sense: to sew or stitch together, stich, Il., Ar.:— Mid., ῥάπτεσθαι ὀχετὸν δερμάτων to make oneself a pipe of leather, Hdt.; ῥαψάμενος τουτί (sc. τὸ προσκεφάλαιον) having got it stitched, Ar.; but also, to sew on or to one, Ar.:—Pass., ἐρράφθαι τὸ χεῖλος to have oneʼs lip sewed up, Dem.
metaph. to devise, contrive, plot, Hom., etc.; proverb., τὸ ὑπόδημα ἔρραψας μὲν σύ, ὑπεδήσατο δὲ Ἀρισταγόρης you made the shoe, but Aristagoras put it on, Hdt.

div1.head: ῥα
div1.sense: enclit. Particle, Hom., and in lyric passages of Trag.

div1.head: Ράριον
div1.sense: τὸ Ράριον (sc. πεδίον) the field of Rarus, sacred to Demeter, where tillage was first practised, Hhymn.

div1.head: Ρᾶρος
div1.sense: Raros, father of Triptolemus.

div1.head: ῥᾳστωνεύω
div1.sense: to be idle, listless, Xen.

div1.head: ῥᾳστώνη
div1.sense: easiness or an easy way of doing anything, Plat.; ῥᾳστώνῃ or μετὰ ῥᾳστώνης with ease, easily, lightly, Plat.; ῥᾳστώνην φυγῆς παρέχειν to provide an easy way of escape, Plut.
easiness of temper, good nature, kindness, Lat. facilitas, τινός to or towards a person, Hdt.

relief or recovery from, τῆς πόσεως from the effects of drinking, Plat.: absol. rest leisure, ease, Plat.; διὰ ῥᾳστώνην for the sake of resting, Xen.: —also luxurious ease, indolence, carelessness, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: ῥαφανιδόω
div1.sense: to thrust a radish up the fundament, a punishment of adulterers in Athens, Ar.

div1.head: ῥαφανίς
div1.sense: the radish, Lat. raphanus, Ar.

div1.head: ῥαφεύς
div1.sense: a stitcher, patcher: metaph., ῥ. φόνου a planner of murder, Aesch.

div1.head: ῥαφή
div1.sense: a seam, Lat. sutura, Od.
the suture of the skull, Hdt.; so, ῥαφαὶ ὀστέων Eur.

div1.head: ῥαφίς
div1.sense: a needle, Anth.

div1.head: ῥαχία
div1.sense: the sea breaking on the shore, esp. the flood-tide, opp. to ἄμπωτις, Hdt.
a rocky shore or beach, Aesch., Thuc.

div1.head: ῥαχίζω
div1.sense: to cut through the spine, to cleave in twain, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: ῥάχις
div1.sense: the lower part of the back, the chine, Il.: then, the spine or backbone, ὑπὸ ῥάχιν παγῆναι to be impaled, Aesch.
anything ridged like the backbone, a mountain-ridge, Hdt.

div1.head: ῥαχιώδης
div1.sense: with surf, Strab.

div1.head: ῥαχός
div1.sense: a thorn-bush, briar, Xen.:— collectively, a thorn-hedge, a wattled fence, Hdt.

div1.head: ῥαψῳδέω
div1.sense: to recite Epic poems, Plat.
in contemptuous sense, to repeat by heart or rote, to declaim, Dem., Luc.; c. inf. to keep saying that . . , Dem.

div1.head: ῥαψῳδία
div1.sense: recitation of Epic poetry, Plat.
Epic composition, opp. to lyric (κιθαρῳδία) , Plat.
a portion of an Epic poem fit for recitation at one time, e. g. a book of the Iliad or Odyssey, a lay, canto, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: ῥαψῳδικός
div1.sense: of or for a rhapsodist: ἡ -κή (with and without τέχνη) , the rhapsodistʼs art, Plat.

div1.head: ῥαψῳδός
div1.sense: properly one who stitches or strings songs together; esp. a person who recited Epic poems, a rhapsodist, applied to Homer, Plat.; but ῥαψῳδοί commonly meant a class of persons who got their living by reciting the poems of Homer, Hdt., Plat.; v. ῥαψῳδία II.
Soph. calls the Sphinx ῥαψῳδὸς κύων, because she proposed her riddle publicly, as the rhapsodists did their lays.

div1.head: Ῥέα
div1.sense: Rhea, daughter of Uranus and Gaia, wife of Cronus, mother of the gods, Hom., etc.

div1.head: ῥέα
div1.sense: easily, lightly, Il.
div1.etym: Sometimes used as one long syll.

div1.head: ῥέγκω
div1.sense: to snore, Lat. sterto, Aesch., Ar.; of horses, to snort, Eur.

div1.head: ῥέζω
div1.sense: to do, act, deal, Od.:—absol., Hom.:—c. acc. rei, to do, accomplish, make, Hom., etc.: —Pass., μῆχος ῥεχθέντος κακοῦ a remedy for mischief once done, Il.

c. dupl. acc. pers. et rei, to do something to one, κακὸν ῥέζειν τινά Hom.; ἀγαθὰ ῥ. τινά Hom.; also more rarely c. dat. pers., μηκέτι μοι κακὰ ῥέζετε do me no more mischiefs, Od.; ὅσα βροτοῖς ἔρεξας κακά Eur.
with strengthd. signf., εἴ τι ῥέξει if it shall avail aught, be of any service, Il.
in spec. sense, to perform sacrifices, Hom., Soph.; absol. to do sacrifice, Lat. operari, facere, ῥέζειν θεῶι Hom.:—sometimes with the victim in acc., ῥέξω βοῦν ἦνιν will sacrifice it, Soph.

div1.head: ῥέθος
div1.sense: a limb, in pl. the limbs, body, Il.
in sg. the face, countenance, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: ῥεῖα
div1.sense: easily, lightly, Hom.; θεοὶ ῥεῖα ζώοντες the gods who live at ease, Lat. securum agentes aevom, Hom.; strengthd. ῥεῖα μάλʼ Il.

div1.head: ῥεῖθρον
div1.sense: that which flows, a river, stream, mostly in pl., ποταμοῖο ῥέεθρα Il.; Στυγὸς ὕδατος αἰπὰ ῥ. Il.; streams of blood, Aesch.:—sg., Hdt., Aesch.
the bed or channel of a river, Il., Hdt.

div1.head: ῥεκτήρ
div1.sense: a worker, doer, Hes.

div1.head: ῥέκτης
div1.sense: active, Plut.

div1.head: ῥέμβω
div1.sense: Mid. to roam, rove, roll about, Plut.: metaph. to be unsteady, act at random, Plut.

div1.head: ῥεμβώδης
div1.sense: roving, rolling, Plut.

div1.head: ῥέος
div1.sense: a stream, Aesch.

div1.head: ῥέπω
div1.sense: properly of the descending scale, to incline downwards, to sink, fall, Lat. vergere, inclinare, Il., Ar.:—of things, to incline one way or the other, to be always shifting, Pind.; ὕπνος ἐπὶ βλεφάροις ῥέπων sleep falling upon the eyes, Pind.
of one of two contending parties, to preponderate, prevail, Hdt., Plat.
of persons, εὖ ῥέπει θεός is favourably inclined, Aesch.; ῥέπειν ἐπί τι to incline towards a thing, Dem.; εἴς or πρός τι Plat., Arist.; εἴς τινα Luc.
of duties, ῥ. εἴς τινα to fall or devolve upon one, Aesch., Soph.
of events, to fall, happen in a certain way, Soph.; ῥ. εἴς τι to turn or come to something, Aesch., Ar.

div1.head: ῥεῦμα
div1.sense: that which flows, a flow, stream, current, Aesch., Soph., etc.
the stream of a river, mostly in pl., Hdt., Eur.; a stream of lava, Thuc.: metaph. a stream or flood of men, Trag., Soph.
a flood, Thuc.
a discharge from the body, a flux, rheum, Luc.

div1.head: ῥευματίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to flow as a current, Strab.

div1.head: ῥευμάτιον
div1.sense: a rivulet, Plut.

div1.head: ῥευστικός
div1.sense: flowing, liquid, Plut.

div1.head: ῥέω
div1.sense: to flow, run, stream, gush, Hom., etc.:—with dat. of that which flows, πηγὴ ῥέει ὕδατι the fountain runs with water, Il.; ῥέεν αἵματι γαῖα Il.; ῥεῖ γάλακτι πέδον Eur.; of a river, μέγας ῥεῖ runs with full stream, Hdt.; so, πολὺς ῥεῖ, metaph. of men, Aesch.; of a river, also, ῥ. ἀπὸ χιόνος to derive its stream from melted snow, Hdt.:—proverb., ἄνω ῥέειν to flow backwards, of impossibilities, Eur.

metaph. of things, ἐκ χειρῶν βέλεα ῥέον from their hands rained darts, Il.; of a flow of words, ἀπὸ γλώσσης μέλιτος γλυκίων ῥέεν αὐδή Il.; absol., of the tongue, to run glibly, Aesch. (cf. Hor., salso multoque fluenti): of words or sentiments, to be current, Soph.
to fall, drop off, e. g. of hair, Od., Theocr.: then, generally, to flow or melt away, perish, Soph., Plat.
of persons, ῥ. ἐπί or εἴς τι to be inclined, given to a thing, Isocr., Plat.
very rarely trans. to let flow, pour, ἔρρει χοάς Eur.
c. acc. cogn., ῥείτω γάλα, μέλι let the land run milk, honey, Theocr.; οἶνον ῥέων Luc.

div1.head: ῥῆγμα
div1.sense: a breakage, fracture, Dem.

div1.head: ῥηγμίν
div1.sense: the sea breaking on the beach, the line of breakers, surf, Hom.; ἐπὶ or παρὰ ῥηγμῖνι θαλάσσης by the edge of the sea, Hom.

div1.head: ῥήγνυμι
div1.sense: to break, break asunder or in pieces, rend, shiver, shatter, Hom., etc.:—to rend garments, in sign of grief, Aesch.:—Mid. to break for oneself, get broken, Il.
to break a line of battle or body of men, Il., Hdt.; in Mid., ῥήξασθαι φάλαγγας, στίχας to break oneself a way through the lines, Il.; absol., ῥήξασθαι to break or force oneʼs way, Il.
to let break loose, let loose, Il.
ῥῆξαι φωνήν to let loose the voice, of children and persons who have been dumb breaking into speech, Hdt.: then to speak freely, speak out (like rumpere vocem, Virgil), Hdt., Ar., etc.
δακρύων ῥήξασα νάματα having let loose floods of tears, Soph.; so, ῥ. κλαυθμόν Plut.
absol. in the form ῥήσσω, to beat the ground, dance, Il.
later, as a term of fighters, to fell, knock down, Dem.
Pass., mostly used in aor2 ἐρράγην α, to break, burst, of waves, Il.; of clouds, Ar.
to break asunder, be rent, of the earth in an earthquake, Plat.; of garments, Xen.
to burst forth, like lightning, Ar.
of ships, to be wrecked, Dem.: metaph. of hopes, Aesch.
intr., like Pass., to break forth, of a river, to break its bounds, Hdt.:—metaph. of sudden misfortunes, bursts of passion, Soph.
in this intr. sense the perf. ἔρρωγα is commonly used of tears, Soph.; metaph., κακῶν πέλαγος ἔρρωγεν Aesch., etc.

div1.head: ῥῆγος
div1.sense: a rug, blanket, used as the covering of a bed or seat, Hom.; or as a garment, Od.

div1.head: ῥηκτός
div1.sense: that can be broken or rent, penetrable, Il.

div1.head: ῥῆμα
div1.sense: that which is said or spoken, a word, saying, Theogn., Hdt., etc.; κατὰ ῥῆμα word for word, Aeschin.
a phrase, opp. to ὄνομα (a single word), Plat.
the subject of speech, a thing, NTest.
in Gramm., a verb, opp. to ὄνομα (a noun), ῥήματα καὶ ὀνόματα Plat.

div1.head: ῥημάτιον
div1.sense: a pet phrase, phrasicle, Ar.

div1.head: ῥηνοφορεύς
div1.sense: clad in sheepskin, Anth.

trans.i: might to break through armed ranks

div1.head: ῥηξήνωρ
div1.sense: breaking through armed ranks, Hom.

div1.head: ῥηξικέλευθος
div1.sense: opening a path, of Apollo, Anth.

div1.head: ῥηξίνοος
div1.sense: breaking the spirit, of Bacchus, Anth.

div1.head: ῥῆξις
div1.sense: a breaking, bursting, ῥήξεις broken flames, a bad omen, Eur.

div1.head: ῥῆσις
div1.sense: a saying, speaking, speech, Od., Hdt., etc.; ἡ ἀπὸ Σκυθῶν ῥῆσις the Scythian phrase, Hdt.
a resolution, declaration, Hdt.
a tale, legend, Pind.
a phrase or passage, a speech in a play, Ar.

div1.head: ῥητέος
div1.sense: one must mention, Plat.

div1.head: ῥητήρ
div1.sense: a speaker, Il.

div1.head: ῥητορεία
div1.sense: skill in public speaking, eloquence, oratory, rhetoric, Plat.
a piece of oratory, set speech, Isocr.

div1.head: ῥητορεύω
div1.sense: to speak in public, to use or practise oratory, Plat.:—Pass., of the speech, to be spoken, Isocr.
to teach oratory, Strab.

div1.head: ῥητορικός
div1.sense: oratorical, rhetorical, ἡ ῥητορική (sc. τέχνη) rhetoric, the art of speaking, Plat.; ῥητορικὴ δειλία an oratorʼs timidity, Aeschin.:— adv. -κῶς, Plat.
of persons, skilled in speaking, fit to be an orator, Plat., etc.

div1.head: ῥητός
div1.sense: stated, specified, Il.; ἐς χρόνον ῥητόν at a set or stated time, Hdt.; ἡμέραι ῥ. Thuc.; ἐπὶ ῥητοῖς γέρασι with fixed prerogatives, Thuc.; ῥ. ἀργύριον a stated sum, Thuc.; ἐπὶ ῥητοῖς on stated terms, on certain conditions, Hdt., Eur.:—adv. ῥητῶς, expressly, distinctly, NTest.
spoken of, known, famous, Hes.
that may be spoken or told, Aesch., Soph.; ῥητὸν ἄρρητόν τʼ ἔπος, Lat. fas nefasque, Soph.
in Mathem., ῥητά are rational quantities, opp. to surds (ἄλογα) , Plat.

div1.head: ῥήτρα
div1.sense: a verbal agreement, bargain, covenant, Od.; παρὰ τὴν ῥήτραν Xen.
the unwritten laws of Lycurgus were called ῥῆτραι, Lex ap. Plut.: generally, a decree, ordinance, Tyrtae., Xen.
speech, a word, Luc.

div1.head: ῥήτωρ
div1.sense: a public speaker, pleader, Lat. orator, Eur., etc.

div1.head: ῥιγεδανός
div1.sense: making one shudder with cold, chilling: metaph., ῥιγεδανὴ Ἑλένη Helen at whose name one shudders, horrible, Il.

div1.head: ῥιγέω
div1.sense: to shiver or shudder with cold: metaph. to shudder with fear or horror, Il., Soph.:—c. inf. to shudder to do, shrink from doing, Il.; also, ῥ. μὴ . . , Od.
to cool or slacken in zeal, Pind.
to bristle with arms, Theocr.
trans. to shudder at anything, Il.

div1.head: ῥιγηλός
div1.sense: making to shiver, chilling, Hes.

div1.head: ῥίγιον
div1.etym: neut. comp. adj. formed from ῥῖγος
div1.sense: more frosty, colder, Od.:—metaph. more horrible, Hom.

div1.head: ῥίγιστος
div1.etym: Sup. adj. formed from ῥῖγος (as κύδιστος from κῦδος)
div1.sense: coldest: most horrible, Il.

div1.head: ῥιγομάχης
div1.sense: fighting with cold, Anth.

div1.head: ῥῖγος
div1.sense: frost, cold, Lat. frigus, Od., etc.

div1.head: ῥιγόω
div1.etym: this word, like ἱδρόω, has an irreg. contr. into ω, ωι, for ου, οι,
div1.sense: to be cold, shiver from cold, Od., Hdt.

div1.head: ῥίζα
div1.sense: a root, Od., Attic: in pl. the roots, Hom.
metaph. the roots of the eye, Od.; the roots or foundations of the earth, Hes., Aesch., etc.
ἐκ ῥιζῶν, Lat. radicitus, Plut.
anything that grows like a root from one stem, whence Pindar calls Libya the τρίτη ῥίζα χθονός, considering the earth as divided into three continents.
metaph. the root or stock from which a family springs, Lat. stirps, Pind., Aesch., etc.; and so a race, family, Aesch., Eur., etc.

div1.head: ῥιζίον
div1.sense: a little root, Ar.

div1.head: ῥιζοβολέω
div1.sense: to strike root, Anth.

div1.head: ῥιζόθεν
div1.sense: by, from the roots, Luc.

div1.head: ῥιζοτόμος
div1.sense: one who cuts roots, Luc.

div1.head: ῥιζοφαγέω
div1.sense: to eat roots, Strab.; ῥ. τὰ σπέρματα to destroy them by nibbling the roots, Strab.

div1.head: ῥιζοφάγος
div1.sense: eating roots, Arist.

div1.head: ῥιζόω
div1.sense: to make to strike root: metaph. to root in the ground, plant, Od.; ἐρρίζωσε τὴν τυραννίδα Hdt.: —Pass. to take root, strike root, Xen.: metaph. to be rooted, firmly fixed, Soph., NTest.
Pass. also of land, to be planted with trees, Od.

div1.head: ῥίζωμα
div1.sense: a root: metaph. a stem, race Aesch.

div1.head: ῥιζωρύχος
div1.sense: root-grubbing, of grammarians, Anth.

div1.head: ῥίζωσις
div1.sense: a taking root, beginning life, Plut.

div1.head: ῥικνός
div1.sense: shrivelled with cold: generally, shrivelled, crooked, Hhymn., Anth.

div1.head: ῥίμφα
div1.sense: adv. lightly, swiftly, fleetly, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: ῥιμφάρματος
div1.sense: of a swift chariot, Pind.; ῥ. ἁμίλλαις with the swift racing of chariots, Soph.

div1.head: ῥινάω
div1.sense: to file, Anth.

div1.head: ῥινεγκαταπηξιγένειος
div1.sense: with a nose reaching to the chin, Anth.

div1.head: ῥινηλατέω
div1.sense: to track by scent, Aesch.

div1.head: ῥινηλάτης
div1.sense: one who tracks by scent, of hounds.

div1.head: ῥίνη
div1.sense: a file or rasp, Xen.

div1.head: ῥινόβολος
div1.sense: emitted through the nose, of a snorting sound, Anth.

div1.head: ῥινόκερως
div1.sense: the rhinoceros or nosehorn, Strab.

div1.head: ῥινόν
div1.sense: a hide, Il.
= ῥινός II. 2, a shield, Od.

div1.head: ῥινόσιμος
div1.sense: snub-nosed, Luc.

div1.head: ῥινός
div1.sense: the skin of a man, Hom.
the hide of a beast, esp. an ox-hide, Hom.
an ox-hide shield, Hom.

div1.head: ῥινοτόρος
div1.sense: shield-piercing, Il., Hes.

div1.head: ῥινοῦχος
div1.sense: a sewer, Lat. cloaca, Strab.

div1.head: ῥίον
div1.sense: any jutting part of a mountain,
the peak, Hom.
a headland, foreland, Od., Thuc.

div1.head: ῥιπή
div1.sense: the swing or force with which anything is thrown, Lat. impetus, αἰγανέης ῥιπή the flight of a javelin, Il.; ῥιπὴ Βορέαο the sweep or rush of the N. wind, Il.; ῥιπὴ Διόθεν, of a storm, Aesch.; ἐννυχιᾶν ἀπὸ ῥιπᾶν prob. means from the quarter of the night storms, i.e. from the North, Soph.; ῥ. πυρός the rush of fire, Il.

ῥ. πτερύγων a flapping of wings, Aesch.; of the buzz of a gnatʼs wing, Aesch.; of quivering light, ῥιπαὶ ἄστρων Soph.; of any rapid movement, ῥ. ποδῶν Eur.; ἐν ῥιπῇ ὀφθαλμοῦ in the twinkling of an eye, NTest.

div1.head: ῥιπίζω
div1.sense: to fan the flame, Lat. conflare, Ar.:—Pass. to be blown about, NTest.

div1.head: ῥιπίς
div1.sense: a fan for raising the fire, Ar.
a ladyʼs fan, Anth.

div1.head: ῥιπτάζω
div1.sense: to throw to and fro, toss about, Lat. jactare, Il.; ὀφρύσι ῥιπτάζειν to move the eyebrows up and down, Hhymn.:—Pass. to be tossed about, Plut.

div1.head: ῥιπτός
div1.sense: thrown, ῥ.μόρος death by being thrown down (a precipice), Soph.

div1.head: ῥίπτω
div1.sense: to throw, cast, hurl, Hom., etc.; ῥ. χθονί to throw on the ground, Soph.:— to cast a net, Pass., ἔρριπται ὁ βόλος the cast has been made, Orac. ap. Hdt.:— to throw or toss about, πλοκάμους Eur.
to cast out of house or land, Soph.:— Pass., μὴ ῥιφθῶ κυσίν Soph.
to throw off or away, of arms, clothes, Eur., etc.
ῥ. λόγους to cast them forth, hurl them, Aesch., Eur.:—but also, to throw them away, waste them, Aesch., Eur.: Pass., οἴχεται ταῦτʼ ἐρριμμένα Soph.
to cast lots or dice, Eur., Plat.
ῥ. ἑαυτόν to throw or cast oneself down, Xen.;—then absol. to fling oneself, ἐς πόντον Theogn.; ἐς τάφρον Eur.

div1.head: ῥίς
div1.sense: the nose, Lat. nasus, Hom., Hdt., etc.
in pl. the nostrils, nose, Lat. nares, Il., etc.

div1.head: ῥίψασπις
div1.sense: throwing away his shield in battle, a recreant, Ar.

div1.head: ῥῖψις
div1.sense: a throwing, casting, hurling, Plat.
a casting about of the eyes, Plut.
a being thrown or hurled, Plat.

div1.head: ῥιψοκίνδυνος
div1.sense: running needless risks, fool-hardy, reckless, Xen.

div1.head: ῥίψοπλος
div1.sense: throwing away oneʼs arms, Aesch.

div1.head: ῥίψ
div1.sense: plaited work, wicker-work, a mat, Lat. crates, Od., etc.

div1.head: ῥόα
div1.sense: Ionic and Epic ῥοιή, a pomegranate-tree, Od.
the fruit, a pomegranate, Hhymn., Ar.
a knob shaped like a pomegranate, Hdt.

div1.head: ῥοδάνη
div1.sense: the woof or weft, Batr.

div1.head: ῥοδανός
div1.sense: waving, flickering, Il.

div1.head: ῥόδεος
div1.sense: of roses, Eur.
like a rose, rosy, Anth.

div1.head: ῥοδῆ
div1.sense: a rose-tree, rose-bush, Archil.

div1.head: Ῥοδιακός
div1.sense: Rhodian, of Rhodes, Strab.: —also Ῥόδιος, η, ον, Il., Xen.

div1.head: ῥοδοδάκτυλος
div1.sense: rosy-fingered, of Aurora, Hom.

div1.head: ῥοδοειδής
div1.sense: rose-like, rosy, Anth.

div1.head: ῥοδόεις
div1.sense: of roses, Il., Eur.
rose-coloured, Anth.

div1.head: ῥοδόμηλον
div1.sense: a rose-apple: metaph. of a rosy cheek, Theocr.

div1.head: ῥόδον
div1.sense: the rose, Lat. rosa, Hhymn., Theogn., etc.; Aeolic βρόδον, Sapph.:—metaph., ῥόδα μʼ εἴρηκας youʼve spoken roses of me, have said all things sweet and lovely, Ar.

div1.head: ῥοδόπηχυς
div1.sense: rosy-armed, Hhymn., Hes., etc.

div1.head: Ῥόδος
div1.sense: the isle of Rhodes, Il., etc.

div1.head: ῥοδωνιά
div1.sense: a rose-bed, garden of roses, Lat. rosarium, Dem., etc.

div1.head: ῥοή
div1.sense: a river, stream, flood, Hom., etc.; mostly in pl., ἐπʼ Ὠκεανοῖο ῥοάων Il.; ἀμπέλου ῥοαί the juice of the grape, Eur.:—metaph. the stream of song or poesy, Pind.; also, ῥοαί the tide of affairs, Pind.

div1.head: ῥοθέω
div1.sense: to make a rushing noise, to dash, of waves or the stroke of oars: hence, of any confused noise, ταῦτα ἐρρόθουν ἐμοί such clamours they raised against me, Soph.; λόγοι ἐρρόθουν there was a noise of words, Soph.

div1.head: ῥοθιάζω
div1.sense: of pigs, to make a guttling noise, Ar.

div1.head: ῥοθιάς
div1.sense: dashing, Aesch.

div1.head: ῥόθιος
div1.sense: rushing, roaring, dashing, of waves, Od.; of oars, Eur.
as Subst. ῥόθια, τά, waves dashing on the beach, breakers, waves, Soph., etc.;—collectively in sg. the surf, surge, Aesch., Eur.
a shout of applause, Ar.; generally, a tumult, riot, Eur.

div1.head: ῥόθος
div1.sense: a rushing noise, dash of waves or of oars, ἐξ ἑνὸς ῥόθου with one stroke, i. e. all at once, Aesch.
of any confused, inarticulate sound, Περσίδος γλώσσης ῥ. the noise of the Persian (i. e. barbarian) tongue, Aesch.

div1.head: ῥοιβδέω
div1.sense: to swallow with a noise, suck down, of Charybdis, Od.; cf. ἀναρροιβδέω.
like ῥοιζέω, to move with a rustling sound, make to rustle, Aesch.

div1.head: ῥοίβδησις
div1.sense: a whistling, piping, Eur.

div1.head: ῥοῖβδος
div1.sense: any rushing noise, πτερῶν ῥ. the whirring of wings, Soph.; ἀνέμου ῥ. whistling of the wind, Ar.

div1.head: ῥοιζέω
div1.sense: to whistle, Lat. stridere, Il.; of a snake, to hiss, Hes.:—Pass. to rush through the air, ἐρροίζητο (3rd sg. plup.) Anth.

div1.head: ῥοίζημα
div1.sense: a rushing, whirring noise or motion, as of birds, Ar.

div1.head: ῥοῖζος
div1.sense: the whistling or whizzing of an arrow, Il.:—any whistling or piping sound, as of a shepherd, Od.
rushing motion, a rush, swing, Plut.

div1.head: ῥοικός
div1.sense: crooked, Theocr.

div1.head: ῥομβητός
div1.sense: spun round like a top, Anth.

div1.head: ῥομβοειδής
div1.sense: rhomboidal, Strab.; ῥ. σχῆμα a rhomboid, a four-sided figure with the opposite sides and angles equal.

div1.head: ῥόμβος
div1.sense: a spinning-top or wheel, Lat. turbo, Eur., Anth.
a magic wheel, used by sorcerers to aid their spells, Theocr., Hor.
a spinning, whirling motion, of a top or wheel, ἱέντα ῥόμβον ἀκόντων shooting forth whirling darts, Pind.; ῥ. αἰετοῦ the eagleʼs swoop, Pind.
a rhomb, lozenge, i. e. a four-sided figure with all the sides, but only the opposite angles, equal, Euclid.
a fish, the turbot, brill.

div1.head: ῥομβωτός
div1.sense: lozenge-shaped, Anth.

div1.head: ῥομφαία
div1.sense: a large sword, scymitar, used by the Thracians, Plut., NTest.

div1.head: ῥόος
div1.sense: a stream, flow, current, Hom., etc.; ποταμοὺς ἔτρεψε νέεσθαι κὰρ ῥόον to flow in their own bed, Il.; κατὰ ῥόον down stream, Od., Hdt., etc.; πρὸς ῥόον against stream, Il.:— a current at sea, Thuc.

div1.head: ῥόπαλον
div1.sense: a club, cudgel, thicker at the buttend; used to cudgel an ass, Il.; to walk with, Od., etc.:— a war-club or mace, shod with metal, Od., Hdt.
= ῥόπτρον III, Xen.

div1.head: ῥοπή
div1.sense: inclination downwards, the sinking of the scale, Aesch.; διαφέρειν τὴν ῥ. to disturb the balance, Plut.

metaph. the turn of the scale, the critical moment, Lat. momentum, ἔχεται ῥοπᾶς (sc. ἡ πόλις) is at a crisis of her fortunes, Alcae. ap. Ar.; ῥ. Δίκας the balance or critical turn of Justice, Aesch.; σμικρὰ παλαιὰ σώματʼ εὐνάζει ῥοπή a slight turn of the scale lays aged bodies to rest, Soph.; ἐπὶ σμικρᾶς ῥοπῆς dependent on a slight turn of the scale, of one dying, Eur.; ἐπὶ ῥοπῆς μιᾶς ὄντες depending on a single turn of the scale, Thuc.; ῥ. βίου the turning point of life, i. e. death, Soph.
metaph. influence, Dem.

div1.head: ῥόπτρον
div1.sense: the wood in a mouse-trap which springs up when touched, Archil.; metaph., δίκης ῥόπτρον Eur.
a tambourine or kettledrum, Luc., Anth.
the knocker on a housedoor, Eur.

div1.head: ῥούσιος
div1.sense: reddish, Lat. russus, Anth.

div1.head: ῥοφέω
div1.sense: to sup greedily up, gulp down, Aesch., Ar.
to drain dry, empty, Ar.; so, ῥ. ἀρτηρίας, of the poison on the robe of Hercules, Soph.

div1.head: ῥοφητικός
div1.sense: drawing in, absorbing, Strab.

div1.head: ῥοφητός
div1.sense: that can be or is supped up, Strab.

div1.head: ῥοχθέω
div1.sense: to dash with a roaring sound, of the sea, Od.

div1.head: ῥόχθος
div1.sense: a roaring of the sea.

div1.head: ῥοώδης
div1.sense: with a strong stream, of a sea in which there are strong currents, Thuc.: of rocks, exposed to such seas, Strab.

div1.head: ῥύαξ
div1.sense: a rushing stream, a torrent, Thuc.; ὁ ῥ. τοῦ πυρός, of a stream of lava, Thuc.

div1.head: ῥύγχος
div1.sense: a snout, muzzle, of swine, Stesich.; of dogs, Theocr.: of birds, a beak, neb, Ar.

div1.head: ῥύδην
div1.sense: flowingly, abundantly, Plut.

div1.head: ῥυδόν
div1.sense: abundantly, Od.

div1.head: ῥύζω
div1.sense: to growl, snarl, ῥύζει ἐπίκλαυτον νόμον snarls its melancholy ditty, Ar.

div1.head: ῥυθμίζω
div1.sense: to bring into measure or proportion: generally, to order, to educate, train, Xen., etc.:—metaph., ῥ. λύπην ὅπου to define the place of grief, Soph.:—Mid., ῥ. πλόκαμον to arrange oneʼs hair, Eur.:—Pass., νηλεῶς ὧδʼ ἐρρύθμισμαι thus ruthlessly am I brought to order, Aesch.

div1.head: ῥυθμός
div1.sense: measured motion, time, rhythm, Lat. numerus, Ar., Plat., etc.: —ἐν ῥυθμῷ in time, Virgilʼs in numerum, Xen.; μετὰ ῥυθμοῦ Thuc.; θάττονα ῥυθμὸν ἐπάγειν to play in quicker time, Xen.
proportion or symmetry of parts, Plat.
generally, arrangement, order, Eur.
the state or condition of the soul, temper, disposition, Theogn., etc.
the form or shape of a thing, Hdt.; of a breastplate, Xen.
the wise, manner or fashion of a thing, Eur.; τίς ῥ. φόνου; what kind of slaughter? Eur.

div1.head: ῥυκάνη
div1.sense: a plane, Anth.

div1.head: ῥῦμα
div1.sense: that which is drawn:
τόξου ῥῦμα, i. e. the Persian archers, opp. to λόγχης ἰσχύς, i. e. the Greek spearmen, Aesch.; ἐκ τόξου ῥύματος from the distance of a bow- shot, Xen.
a towing-line, Polyb.
(ῥύομαι) a defence, protection, Eur.; πύργου ῥ. a tower of defence, Soph.

div1.head: ῥύμη
div1.sense: the force, swing, rush of a body in motion, Lat. impetus, ῥύμῃ with a swing, Thuc.; πτερύγων ῥύμη the rush of wings, Ar.; ἡ ῥ. τῶν ἵππων Xen.:—metaph., εὐτυχεῖ ῥύμῃ θεοῦ Eur.; ἡ ῥ. τῆς ὀργῆς the vehemence of passion, Dem.
absol. a rush, charge, of soldiers, Thuc., Xen.
a street, Lat. vicus, Polyb., NTest.

div1.head: ῥύμμα
div1.sense: anything for washing, soap, Plat.

div1.head: ῥυμός
div1.sense: the pole of a carriage, Il., Hdt.; ἐν πρώτῳ ῥυμῷ at the end of the pole, Il.

div1.head: ῥυμουλκέω
div1.sense: to tow, Polyb., etc.

div1.head: ῥύομαι
div1.sense: to draw to oneself, i. e. draw out of danger, to rescue, save, deliver, Hom., Hes., etc.; ῥ. τινα ὑπὲκ θανάτου, ὑπὲκ κακοῦ to save from . . , Hom.;—so c. gen., ῥ. τινα τοῦ μὴ κατακαυθῆναι Hdt.; or c. inf. alone, ῥ. τινα θανεῖν or μὴ κατθανεῖν Eur.: also, to save from an illness, cure, Hdt.: to set free, redeem, Il.; ἐκ δουλοσύνης Hdt.
generally, to shield, guard, protect, of guardian gods, chiefs, etc., Il. etc.:—of defensive armour, Il.
Soph. has ῥῦσαι in a double sense, ῥῦσαι σεαυτὸν . . , ῥῦσαι δὲ μίασμα τοῦ τεθνηκότος deliver thyself,—and deliver us from the pollution; so, ῥ. τὰς αἰτίας to remove the charges, Thuc.
to draw back, to hold back, check, Od., Pind.
to keep off, Pind.

div1.head: ῥυπαίνω
div1.sense: to defile, disfigure, disparage, Arist.:—Pass. to be or become foul, Xen.

div1.head: ῥυπαρία
div1.sense: dirt, filth: sordidness, Critias, Plut.

div1.head: ῥυπαρός
div1.sense: foul, filthy, dirty:—metaph. dirty, sordid, Arist.:—adv. -ρῶς, Anth.

div1.head: ῥυπάω
div1.sense: to be foul, filthy, dirty, Od.; imperf. ἐρρύπων, Ar.

div1.head: ῥυπόω
div1.sense: Pass. to be foul, perf. part. ῥερυπωμένος, Epic for ἐρρυπωμένοι, fouled, soiled, Od.

div1.head: ῥύπος
div1.sense: dirt, filth, dirtiness, uncleanness, heterocl. pl. ῥύπα, Od.; in sg., Plat., etc.

div1.head: ῥυππαπαί
div1.sense: a cry of the Athenian rowers, like ὠόπ, yoho! Ar.; hence, τὸ ῥυππαπαί oneʼs messmates, Ar.

div1.head: ῥύπτω
div1.sense: to remove dirt from garments, to wash, Arist.:—Pass. to wash oneself, ἐξ ὅτου ἐγὼ ῥύπτομαι ever since I began to wash, i. e. from childhood, Ar.

div1.head: ῥυσαίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be wrinkled, Anth.

div1.head: ῥυσιάζω
div1.sense: to seize as a pledge, to drag away, Eur.:—Pass. to be so dragged away, Eur.

div1.head: ῥυσίβωμος
div1.sense: defending altars, Aesch.

div1.head: ῥυσίδιφρος
div1.sense: preserving the chariot, Pind.

div1.head: ῥύσιον
div1.sense: that which is dragged away:
booty, prey, ῥύσια ἐλαύνεσθαι, of cattle, Il.; τοῦ ῥυσίου θʼ ἥμαρτε, i. e. Helen., Aesch.
that which is seized as a pledge, a pledge, surety, ῥύσια δοῦναι Solon.; ῥύσιον τιθέναι Soph.
that which is seized by way of reprisal, φόνον φόνου ῥύσιον τῖσαι to suffer death in reprisal for death, Soph.
in pl. offerings for deliverance, Anth.

div1.head: ῥύσιος
div1.sense: delivering, saving, Aesch., Anth.

div1.head: ῥυσίπολις
div1.sense: saving the city, Aesch.

div1.head: ῥυσίπονος
div1.sense: setting free from trouble, Anth.

div1.head: ῥύσις
div1.sense: a flowing, flow, Plat.
the course of a river, stream, Polyb.

div1.head: ῥύσκομαι
div1.etym: = ῥύομαι· ῥύσκευ, Epic 2nd sg. imperf., Il.

div1.head: ῥυσός
div1.sense: drawn up, shrivelled, wrinkled, Il., Eur., etc.; ῥ. ἐπισκύνιον, of a frown, Anth.

div1.head: ῥυσότης
div1.sense: wrinkledness, wrinkles, Plut.

div1.head: ῥυστάζω
div1.sense: to drag about, πολλὰ ῥυστάζεσκεν (3rd sg. Ionic imperf.) περὶ σῆμα he dragged it many times round the grave of Patroclus, Il.; δμωὰς ῥυστάζειν κατὰ δώματα, Od.

div1.head: ῥυστακτύς
div1.sense: a dragging about, maltreatment, Od.

div1.head: ῥυταγωγεύς
div1.sense: the rope of a horseʼs halter, Xen.

div1.head: ῥυτήρ
div1.sense: one who draws or stretches, ῥ. βιοῦ, ὀϊστῶν drawer of the bow, of arrows, Od.
like ἱμάς, the strap by which a horse draws, a trace, Il.:—also a rein, Il.; ἀπὸ ῥυτῆρος with loose rein, Lat. immissis habenis, at full galop:—used as a strap to flog with, Dem., Aeschin.
(ῥύομαι) a saver, guard, defender, Od.

div1.head: ῥυτιδόφλοιος
div1.sense: with shrivelled rind, σῦκον Anth.

div1.head: ῥυτιδόω
div1.sense: to make wrinkled:—Pass. to be so, perf. part. ἐρρυτιδωμένος Luc.

div1.head: ῥυτίς
div1.sense: a fold or pucker in the face, a wrinkle, Lat. ruga, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: ῥυτόν
div1.sense: a rein, Hes.
(ῥέω) a drinking-cup, running to a point with a small hole, through which the wine ran, Dem.

div1.head: ῥυτός
div1.sense: dragged along, ῥυτοὶ λάες stones dragged along, i. e. too large to carry, Od.

div1.head: ῥυτός
div1.sense: flowing, running, fluid, liquid, Trag.

div1.head: ῥύτωρ
div1.sense: a saviour, deliverer, Aesch., Anth.; τινός from a thing, Anth.

div0.div1:
*
ῥύω , whence ἐρύω, to draw v. ῥύομαι.

div1.head: ῥωγαλέος
div1.sense: broken, cleft, rent, torn, Hom.

div1.head: ῥωγάς
div1.sense: ragged, Babr.; ῥ. πέτρα a cloven rock, Theocr.

div1.head: ῥώθων
div1.sense: the nose: in pl. the nostrils, Strab.

div1.head: Ῥωμαϊκός
div1.sense: Roman, a Roman, Polyb., etc.; adv. -κῶς, in Latin, Anth.

div1.head: Ῥωμαϊστί
div1.sense: in Latin, Plut.

div1.head: ῥωμαλέος
div1.sense: strong of body, Plat.
of things, mighty, strong, Hdt.

div1.head: ῥώμη
div1.sense: bodily strength, strength, might, Hdt., Trag., etc.; οὐ μιᾷ ῥώμῃ not single-handed, Soph.
a force, i. e. army, Xen.

div1.head: ῥώννυμι
div1.sense: to strengthen, make strong and mighty, Plut.
mostly in perf. pass. (with pres. sense) ἔρρωμαι, and plup. ἐρρώμην (as imperf.):— to put forth strength, have strength or might, Eur., Thuc.:—c. inf. to have strength to do, be eager to do, Thuc.
often in imperat., ἔρρωσο, farewell, Lat. vale, Xen.; also, φράζειν τινὶ ἐρρῶσθαι, Lat. valere jubere, Plat.
part. ἐρρωμένος, ῥωμαλέος, v. sub voce.

div1.head: ῥώξ
div1.sense: a cleft: in Od., ῥῶγες μεγάροιο are narrow passages leading to the hall.

div1.head: ῥώομαι
div1.sense: to move with speed or violence, to dart, rush, rush on, Hom.; ῥ. περὶ πυρήν Od.; ἀμφʼ Ἀχελώιον ἐρρώσαντο danced about Achelous, Il.; χορὸν ἐρρώσαντο plied the lusty dance, Hhymn.; ὑπὸ ῥώοντο ἄνακτι lustily they moved under the kingʼs weight, Il.; so, γούνατα ἐρρώσαντο Od.; also of the hair, ἐρρώοντο μετὰ πνοιῇς ἀνέμοιο it waved streaming in the wind, Il.

div1.head: ρ
div1.sense: Ρ, ρ, ῥῶ, τό, indecl., seventeenth letter of Gr. Alphabet, as numeral ρʹ 100, but ͵ρ 100, 000. Dialectic and other changes:
Aeolic, at the end of words ς passed into ρ, as οὗτορ, ἵππορ for οὗτος, ἵππος; cf. Lat. arbor arbos, honor honos.
in Attic, ρρ replaced the Ionic and old Attic ρς, as ἄρρην, θάρρος for ἄρσην, θάρσος.
in some words ρ is transposed, as κάρτος Epic for κράτος, ἀταρπός for ἀτραπός, κραδίη for καρδία:—mostly in Poets.
ρ at the beginning of a word was pronounced so as to make a short vowel at the end of the word before long by position, as, ψυχρὴ ὑπὸ ῥιπῆς Il.
by reason of this pronunc., ρ was doubled after a prep. or α privat., and after the augment, as ἀπορρίπτω, ἄρρωστος, ἔρριψα.
if ρ begins a word, it takes the rough breathing, except in Aeolic

div1.head: ῥωπήϊον
div1.sense: brushes, brushwood, Il.

div1.head: ῥωπικός
div1.sense: of or for petty wares, trumpery, worthless, Plut.; ῥωπικὰ γράψασθαι to paint poorly, coarsely, Anth.

div1.head: ῥῶπος
div1.sense: petty wares, Aesch., Dem.

div1.head: ῥωχμός
div1.sense: a cleft, ῥωχμὸς γαίης a gutter scooped out by heavy rains, Il.

div1.head: ῥώψ
div1.sense: a shrub, bush: only pl. bushes, underwood, brushwood, Od. Od.
